topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack® Carrier Grade (Alpha): Rebuilding Instances

body.p: The rebuild operation removes all data on the server and replaces it with the specified image.
A rebuild operation always removes data injected into the file system through server personality. You can reinsert data into the file system during the rebuild.

li.p: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Helion Dashboard.
Click the Project dashboard, then the System panel, then the Instances link.
In the Instances screen, for the instance you want to rebuild, click the arrow icon in the Actions menu and select Rebuild Instance.
In the Rebuild Instances screen, select the image to use to rebuild the instance. You can select the same image or rebuild using a different image.
The progress of the reboot is displayed in the Task column on the Instances screen.
